column1: Information on these and other questions can be found at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) website. The CDC is a good source for up-to-date factual information on COVID-19. https://t.co/IirN9j3xtb
As COVID-19 vaccine development continues to progress South Dakotans have asked me important questions such as the plan to distribute a vaccine or when it will be available.
Coronavirus Food Assistance Program 2 (CFAP2) applications remain open until Dec. 11 for farmers and ranchers impacted by the  COVID-19 pandemic.   More info ⬇️  https://t.co/6BV192rmEq

South Dakotans & all Americans continue to struggle because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The common-sense targeted bill we tried to move forward today would have provided immediate relief to families businesses schools and healthcare providers at a time when they need it most.

As the COVID-19 pandemic continues South Dakotans—especially those in rural areas—need to know they can access medical attention when they need it. Fortunately telehealth services have become an easy and safe way for folks to speak with a medical professional from their home.

Thousands of SD small businesses utilized the PPP to help stay afloat through COVID-19. But the loan forgiveness paperwork requirements are burdensome & unnecessary-particularly for those with smaller loans. I continue to push for automatic loan forgiveness for loans under $150k https://t.co/QO2M1cuZ2Z

I introduced legislation today with @SenJohnThune and others that would extend for two years the FDA’s guidance allowing for preparation of hand sanitizer products during the COVID-19 crisis. This guidance includes allowing ethanol production for hand sanitizer.

Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic our economy was soaring. Jobs were being created unemployment was at record lows and wages were rising. We believe that as soon as we can begin to fully reopen our economy will come back stronger than ever. Read more here: https://t.co/Bb5gjf5cZe

COVID-19 has put our nation’s food supply chain to the test. The last thing we want to see during a global pandemic is a major food shortage. This crisis highlights the urgent need to pass our legislation that allows for sales of meat and poultry across state lines.
